description: Mount Judi (also al-Ǧūdiyy, Cûdî‎, Cudi), also spelled Guti and Kutu, is a mountain where Sennacherib had several monuments carved. The Neo-Assyrian name is Mount Nipur.

properties.description: Representative location of the mountain peak is based on a node derived from OpenStreetMap.

names.description: Alternate modern spelling of Judi Dagh.

names.details: Cebel-i Cūdī: They are two mountains, one of which is three days’ journey in length and half a day’s travel in height. One of them is Cebel-i Aḫḍar (Mount Akhzar), whose vegetation is mostly hidden within the clouds. Altogether it casts its shadow over Cezīre-i İbn ‘Ömer. On its eastern side it overlooks and descends toward the Dicle (Tigris)... [partial translation]
